com.solvvy.mturk

Class PhaseOneTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solvvy.mturk.IntelligenceTask
      • com.solvvy.mturk.PhaseOneTask

  • public class PhaseOneTask
extends IntelligenceTask
    Phase-one tasks ask the mechanical turk worker to determine if a given response to a question could reasonably be called a candidate solution to the question. The purpose of these tasks is to filter out bad snippets.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PhaseOneTask.PhaseOneTaskId
      A unique identifier for a single submitted HIT, consisting of the ID of the provided question and a list of the IDs of the provided snippets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhaseOneTask

        public PhaseOneTask(Question question,
                    Collection<Snippet> responses)
        Constructs a PhaseOneTask from a question and a collection of responses, encapsulating all of the information required to create a HIT via the MTurk API.
        Parameters:
        question - the question being responded to by the snippets
        responses - the potentially-candidate solutions to the given question

    • Method Detail

      • submitTasks

        public static void submitTasks(Collection<PhaseOneTask> tasks)
        Creates a HIT for each snippet associated with the given question and updates each snippet's record with its associated HIT id.
        Parameters:
        tasks - the phase one tasks for which to submit HITs

      • newTasks

        public static com.google.common.collect.ListMultimap<Question,PhaseOneTask> newTasks(Iterable<Question> questions)
        For each question in the provided list of questions, query the database for all responses to the question and construct human intelligence tasks for all questions and responses.
        Parameters:
        questions - the list of questions from which to create tasks
        Returns:
        a list of new HITs for the given questions

      • getResults

        public static com.google.common.collect.ListMultimap<Snippet.Id,WorkerAnswer<PhaseOneAnswer>> getResults(String hitTypeId)
        Given a HIT type ID, returns a map from snippet to the individual boolean verdicts for each snippet, determining whether or not it is a candidate solution.
        Parameters:
        hitTypeId - a unique identifier of a specific set of tasks
        Returns:
        a mapping from snippet ids to all recorded responses for the ids' associated content

      • getResults

        public static com.google.common.collect.ListMultimap<Snippet.Id,WorkerAnswer<PhaseOneAnswer>> getResults(Collection<com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.HIT> reviewableHits)
        Given a list of reviewable phase-one HITs, returns a map from snippet to the individual boolean verdicts for each snippet, determining whether or not it is a candidate solution.

        This requires the aws api to be thread safe.

        Parameters:
        reviewableHits - a list of reviewable phase-one tasks
        Returns:
        a map from snippet to individual boolean verdicts

      • updateSnippetCandidacies

        public static void updateSnippetCandidacies(com.google.common.collect.ListMultimap<Snippet.Id,WorkerAnswer<PhaseOneAnswer>> results)
        Updates the snippet records' candidacy flag for all snippets with recorded results. A snippet is considered a candidate if more respondents marked "Yes" than "No". Additionally updates worker statistics for all involved worker ids.
        Parameters:
        results - a mapping from snippet ids to the snippets' recorded boolean results.

      • reviewWork

        public static void reviewWork(com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.HITStatus hitStatus)
        Gets all tasks in the given state of review, gets the results for those tasks, updates snippets to reflect if they are considered candidates or not, and updates worker qualifications based on their performance on these tasks.

        This should almost always be called with the argument "Reviewable," for the simple reason that once tasks are reviewed, they should already have updated the snippets and worker stats. To do so again is to risk duplicating statistics.

        Parameters:
        hitStatus - the status of HITs to review; either Reviewable or Reviewing

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
